intro: Senecio garcibarrigae, commonly known as the Garcibarriga groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in drought conditions. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
